member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FixedRowIndicator.Default
member.summary: Default is resolved to None.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FixedRowIndicator.None
member.summary: No ui is provided for fixing/unfixing rows.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FixedRowIndicator.Button
member.summary: A state button with the pin icon is displayed in the row selectors. This option will increase the default width of the row selectors to accomodate the button.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FixedRowSortOrder
member.summary: Enum for specifying property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FixedRowSortOrder.Default
member.summary: Default is resolved to Sorted.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FixedRowSortOrder.FixOrder
member.summary: Fixed rows remain in the same order as they are fixed, even after the sorted columns are changed. Calling RefreshSort method on the FixedRowsCollection will resort the fixed rows based on the sorted columns.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FixedRowSortOrder.Sorted
member.summary: Fixed rows are sorted when the user sorts columns. Note that however when the user fixes a row the row is always added at the end of the fixed rows. To insert it into the correct sort position call RefreshSort method on the associated FixedRowsCollection in AfterRowFixedStateChanged event handler.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FixedRowStyle
member.summary: Enum for specifying property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FixedRowStyle.Default
member.summary: Default is resolved to Top.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FixedRowStyle.Top
member.summary: Rows will be fixed on top of the row collection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FixedRowStyle.Bottom
member.summary: Rows will be fixed on bottom of the row collection.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode
member.summary: Enum used for specifying the property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.Default
member.summary: The default mode.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.Date
member.summary: The groups are based on the date portion of DateTime values found in the column's cells. The column's must be System.DateTime for this mode to work properly.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.FirstCharacter
member.summary: The groups are based on the first character of the cell text. This option is intended to be used when the columns data type is String.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.First2Characters
member.summary: The groups are based on the first two characters of the cell text. This option is intended to be used when the columns data type is String.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.First3Characters
member.summary: The groups are based on the first three characters of the cell text. This option is intended to be used when the columns data type is String.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.First4Characters
member.summary: The groups are based on the first four characters of the cell text. This option is intended to be used when the columns data type is String.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.Hour
member.summary: The groups are based on the date and hour portions of DateTime values found in the column's cells. The column's must be System.DateTime for this mode to work properly.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.Minute
member.summary: The groups are based on the date, hour, and minute portions of DateTime values found in the column's cells. The column's must be System.DateTime for this mode to work properly.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.Month
member.summary: The groups are based on the year and month portions of DateTime values found in the column's cells. The column's must be System.DateTime for this mode to work properly.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.OutlookDate
member.summary: The groups are created in the same way that Outlook 2003 creates groups for dates. The column's must be System.DateTime for this mode to work properly.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.Quarter
member.summary: The groups are based on the quarter and year that the cell values are in. The column's must be System.DateTime for this mode to work properly.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.Second
member.summary: The groups are based on the date, hour, minute, and second portions of DateTime values found in the column's cells. The column's must be System.DateTime for this mode to work properly.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.Text
member.summary: The groups are based on the text of the cells, not their values.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.Value
member.summary: The groups are based on the value of the cells, not their text. Note, the description of each groupby row will use the text of the cell by default.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByMode.Year
member.summary: The groups are based on the year portion of DateTime values found in the column's cells. The column's must be System.DateTime for this mode to work properly.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByRowExpansionStyle
member.summary: Used by the property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByRowExpansionStyle.Default
member.summary: The default setting.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByRowExpansionStyle.ExpansionIndicatorAndDoubleClick
member.summary: GroupBy rows can be expanded/collapsed via an expansion indicator and double clicking on the GroupBy row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByRowExpansionStyle.ExpansionIndicator
member.summary: GroupBy rows can be expanded/collapsed via an expansion indicator on the GroupBy row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByRowExpansionStyle.DoubleClick
member.summary: GroupBy rows can be expanded/collapsed via double clicking on the GroupBy row. When this setting is used the GroupBy rows will not contain expansion indicators.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByRowExpansionStyle.Disabled
member.summary: GroupBy rows cannot be expanded/collapsed by the end-user.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByRowInitialExpansionState
member.summary: Used by the property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByRowInitialExpansionState.Default
member.summary: The default setting.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByRowInitialExpansionState.Collapsed
member.summary: When the grid groups on a column all of the rows will be collapsed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByRowInitialExpansionState.Expanded
member.summary: When the grid groups on a column all of the rows will be expanded.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByBoxStyle
member.summary: Constants that specify whether the GroupByBox will appear at full size or compacted

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByBoxStyle.Full
member.summary: Full. The GroupByBox will appear at its full size.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByBoxStyle.Compact
member.summary: Compact. The GroupByBox will appear compacted, occupying the least amount of screen real estate possible.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupBySummaryDisplayStyle
member.summary: Enum for specifying property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupBySummaryDisplayStyle.Default
member.summary: Default is resolved to Text. This maintains the backward compatibility.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupBySummaryDisplayStyle.Text
member.summary: Summaries are appended to the group-by rows description.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupBySummaryDisplayStyle.SummaryCells
member.summary: Summaries are displayed as cells in group-by row. These summary cells are positioned according the SummarySettings SummaryPosition settings. If the summary cells do not intersect with the group-by row description then they are positioned in the same level as the description. If at least one summary cell intersects with the group-by row description then all the summary cells are positioned below the description.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupBySummaryDisplayStyle.SummaryCellsAlwaysBelowDescription
member.summary: Summaries are displayed as cells in group-by row. These summary cells are positioned according the SummarySettings SummaryPosition settings. All the summary cells are positioned below the description so they do not conflict with the group-by row description.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderClickAction
member.summary: Used to specify how a column or group header should react to being clicked.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderClickAction.Default
member.summary: Use Default. The setting of the object's parent will be used (or 'Select' if not parent is set to default).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderClickAction.Select
member.summary: Select. Selects the column or group (based on the setting of the SelectTypeCol property).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderClickAction.SortSingle
member.summary: Single Selection Sort. Changes the sort indicator for the column after clearing all other columns' sort indicators.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderClickAction.SortMulti
member.summary: Multiple Selection Sort. Changes the sort indicator for the column. If the shift key is pressed does not clear other columns sort indicators.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderClickAction.ExternalSortSingle
member.summary: Same as SortSingle except with ExternalSortSingle UltraGrid won't perform the sort itself. This is useful if you want to sort externally through the data source. You can hook into the event and apply the sort to the external data source.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderClickAction.ExternalSortMulti
member.summary: Same as SortMulti except with ExternalSortMulti UltraGrid won't perform the sort itself. This is useful if you want to sort externally through the data source. You can hook into the event and apply the sort to the external data source.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderPlacement
member.summary: Enum for specifying the property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderPlacement.Default
member.summary: The default is resolved to RepeatOnBreak.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderPlacement.RepeatOnBreak
member.summary: Headers are repeated on every band break. The current row displays headers if the previous row is from a different row collection. This is the default behavior.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderPlacement.FixedOnTop
member.summary: Headers of all the bands are displayed on top. They always remain visible, even if a row from that band is currently not visible. You can hide headers of certain bands by setting the existing ColHeadersVisible property of the band.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderPlacement.OncePerRowIsland
member.summary: Headers are displayed only once per row island. When a row is expanded with visible children, the next sibling does not display the headers.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderPlacement.OncePerGroupedRowIsland
member.summary: Same as OncePerRowIsland however when rows are grouped by one or more columns, the headers are displayed above the group-by-rows. Here the row island is taken to mean the collection of rows associated with an IList.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GridRowType
member.summary: Used for specifying the rowType parameter of the UltraGridBand's and RowsCollection's methods.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GridRowType.DataRow
member.summary: Data rows.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GridRowType.GroupByRow
member.summary: Group-by rows.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.InvalidValueBehavior
member.summary: Enum for specifying and properties.

member.summary: Default. Default is resolved to RetainValueAndFocus.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.InvalidValueBehavior.RetainValueAndFocus
member.summary: Retains the value entered by the user and also keeps the cell in edit mode.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.InvalidValueBehavior.RevertValue
member.summary: Reverts the value back to the original value. The cell does not stay in edit mode.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.InvalidValueBehavior.RevertValueAndRetainFocus
member.summary: Reverts the value back to the original value and the cell is kept in edit mode.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.LabelPosition.LabelOnly
member.summary: Cells of the column won't be shown. Only the label will be shown.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.LoadStyle
member.summary: Enum associated with property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.LoadStyle.PreloadRows
member.summary: Pre-loads all rows.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.LoadStyle.LoadOnDemand
member.summary: Loads rows as they are needed. NOTE: Some operations, like sorting rows, will cause the all rows to be loaded regardless of the load style setting because they require access to all rows. For example if you have a summary that sums the values of a column then when the summary is calculated all the rows will be loaded.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutCellNavigation
member.summary: Enum for specifying property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutCellNavigation.Default
member.summary: Default. Deault is resolved to Snaking.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutCellNavigation.Snaking
member.summary: When navigating cells using left/right/up/down arrow keys, Snaking option will traverse all the cells of a row before moving to a different row. For example, when navigating via down arrow if the current cell is the last cell in the logical row-layout column then the first cell in the next logical column of the same row will be activated.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutCellNavigation.Adjacent
member.summary: When navigating cells using left/right/up/down arrow keys, Adjacent option will move to the next row once the cells in current logical row-layout column or row are exhausted. For example, when navigating via down arrow if the current cell is the last cell in the logical row-layout column then the first cell of that same logical row-layout column in the next row will be activated.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowScrollAction.Bottom

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowSizing
member.summary: Used to specify the way rows can be resized.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowSizing.Default
member.summary: Use Default. The setting of the object's parent will be used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowSizing.Fixed
member.summary: Fixed. Rows cannot be resized by the user and will not be by the control.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowSizing.Free
member.summary: Free. Rows can be resized by the user on a row-by-row basis.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowSizing.Sychronized
member.summary: Synchronized. All rows will have the same height. Rows can be resized simultaneously - resizing a single row resizes all rows.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowSizing.AutoFixed
member.summary: Auto-Sizing Fixed. The control will resize each row to the size of the largest cell in that row. The user is not allowed to resize the rows.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowSizing.AutoFree
member.summary: Auto-Sizing Free. The control will resize each row to the size of the largest cell in that row. The user is allowed to resize the rows.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowSizingArea
member.summary: Used to specify the interface used to resize rows.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowSizingArea.Default
member.summary: Use Default. The setting of the object's parent will be used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowSizingArea.RowSelectorsOnly
member.summary: Row Selectors Only. Only the edges of row selectors are used to resize rows.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowSizingArea.RowBordersOnly
member.summary: Borders Only. Only the borders between rows are used to resize rows.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowSizingArea.EntireRow
member.summary: Entire Row. Row borders and record selector edges are both used to resize rows.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowUpdateCancelAction
member.summary: Indicates the action should be taken when BeforeRowUpdate event is cancelled.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowUpdateCancelAction.CancelUpdate
member.summary: Cancelling the BeforeRowUpdate event will cause the UltraGrid to call CancelEdit on the underlying row object (if the row object is an IEditableObject).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowUpdateCancelAction.RetainDataAndActivation
member.summary: Cancelling the BeforeRowUpdate event will cause the UltraGrid to retain the currently typed data and also retain activation on the row.

This will allow the user to sort rows by a column by clicking on the column's header. To sort the rows by one or more columns in code, add the columns to the Band's collection.

member.summary: Descending. The column should be sorted in descending order.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SortIndicator.Disabled

member.summary: A separator is displayed before the empty rows. for more information on how to enable the empty rows functionality.

member.summary: Reserved. For internal use only.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SpecialRowSeparator.All

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryDisplayAreas
member.summary: Enum for specifying property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryDisplayAreas.Default
member.summary: Default. Default is resolved to the and property settings. In other words if those properties are left to their default values, then the summaries will be displayed in the summary footer at the end of each row collection and in each group-by row (not aligned to columns).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryDisplayAreas.None
member.summary: Summary is not displayed anywhere. This overrides the and properties.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryDisplayAreas.Top
member.summary: Summary is displayed in the beginning of the row collection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryDisplayAreas.TopFixed
member.summary: Summary is displayed in the beginning of the row collection. In root row collection the summary is fixed so it doesn't get scrolled out of view. In child row collections this behaves in the same way as Top.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryDisplayAreas.Bottom
member.summary: Summary is displayed at the end of the row collection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryDisplayAreas.BottomFixed
member.summary: Summary is displayed at the end of the row collection. In root row collection the summary is fixed so it doesn't get scrolled out of view. In child row collections this behaves in the same way as Bottom.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryDisplayAreas.InGroupByRows
member.summary: Summary is displayed in each group-by row. This property overrides the property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryDisplayAreas.GroupByRowsFooter
member.summary: Summary is displayed in the summary footers of group-by row collections. This flag must be combined with either Top, TopFixed, Bottom or BottomFixed in order for it to have any effect.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryDisplayAreas.HideDataRowFooters
member.summary: Hides the summary footers of data rows. This is useful when rows are grouped and you want to show the summary footers of group-by rows only.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryDisplayAreas.RootRowsFootersOnly
member.summary: Only displays the summary footers on the root rows collection (root level). This is useful when rows are grouped and you want to show the summary footers of the root group-by rows. When rows are not grouped this flag has no effect. Note that this does not have any effect on the workings of InGroupByRows option. InGroupByRows will still work the same way regardless of the value of this flag.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryPosition
member.summary: Indicates the location where a summary will be displayed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryPosition.Left
member.summary: The summary will be displayed on the left of the footer. If there are multiple SummarySettings objects with Left as the ShowLocation, then they will be displayed in order that they occur in the SummarySettingsCollection they belong to.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryPosition.Right
member.summary: The summary will be displayed on the right of the footer. If there are multiple SummarySettings objects with Right as the ShowLocation, then they will be displayed in order that they occur in the SummarySettingsCollection they belong to.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryPosition.Center
member.summary: The summary will be displayed on the center of the footer. If there are multiple SummarySettings objects with Center as the ShowLocation, then they will be displayed in order that they occur in the SummarySettingsCollection they belong to.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryPosition.UseSummaryPositionColumn
member.summary: If UseLocationColumn is specified, then the summary will be displayed under the LocationColumn. If LocationColumn is null, then the summary won't be displayed at all. LocationColumn column must be from the same band as the band SummariesCollection is from. If an attemt is made to assign a column not from the same band, an exception will be throw.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryType
member.summary: Used to specify the type of summary to calculate on a object.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryType.Average
member.summary: Average of values. Null values are taken as 0 and averaged.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryType.Sum
member.summary: Sum of all values.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryType.Minimum
member.summary: Minimum value. Null values are ignored and minimum of non-null values is calculated.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryType.Maximum
member.summary: Maximum value.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryType.Count
member.summary: Number of rows. Null values are taken into account as well.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.SummaryType.Formula

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultipleBandSupport
member.summary: Enum for specifying the property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultipleBandSupport.ShowBandSelectionUI
member.summary: A user interface for letting the user select a different band is displayed. This is the default option. Initially if the property is set then the columns from that band will be displayed otherwise columns from all bands are displayed. The user then can choose a specific band to display the columns from by selecting that band from the band selector UI. Note: If there is a single band in the UltraGrid then this option will NOT show the band selection UI.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultipleBandSupport.DisplayColumnsFromAllBands
member.summary: Columns from all bands are displayed in the columns list, grouped by the band. Since columns from all bands are displayed, the user interface for selecting a band is not displayed. Note that the property will be ignored by this option and will be reset to null.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultipleBandSupport.SingleBandOnly
member.summary: Only columns from a single band are displayed. No user interface for selecting a different band is available. To specify the band whose columns to display , set the property. If that property is left to null then columns from root band will be displayed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.XsdConstraintFlags.FixedValue

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.XsdConstraintFlags.ImplicitXsdBaseTypeConstraints
member.summary: Specifies that the implicit constraints imposed by the built-in XSD base type should be enforced. For example, if the base XSD type is 'positiveInteger' then the cell value must be greater than zero.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.XsdConstraintFlags.MaxExclusive

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.XsdConstraintFlags.MinExclusive

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.DropDownSearchMethod
member.summary: Indicates the method used to search an UltraDropDown or UltraCombo Control when searching for a DisplayText or DataValue.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.DropDownSearchMethod.Default
member.summary: Use the default search method (Binary).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.DropDownSearchMethod.Linear
member.summary: Use a linear search. Linear searches are slower than binary, but there is less of an initial delay when loading the control with data.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.DropDownSearchMethod.Binary
member.summary: Use a Binary search. Binary searches are faster than Linear searches, but require an initial performance hit to build and maintain a sorted list of data.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.EditAreaDisplayStyle
member.summary: Determines whether the displays the image of the selected item in the edit portion of the control.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.EditAreaDisplayStyle.Default
member.summary: Default (DisplayTextAndPicture).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.EditAreaDisplayStyle.DisplayTextAndPicture
member.summary: Show the DisplayText and the picture, if there is one.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.EditAreaDisplayStyle.DisplayText
member.summary: Show only the DisplayText. Do not display the image.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowEditTemplateUIType
member.summary: Indicates when the grid will show the RowEditTemplate, if set.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowEditTemplateUIType.Default
member.summary: The default action will be taken.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowEditTemplateUIType.None
member.summary: The template will never be shown automatically.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowEditTemplateUIType.OnDoubleClickRow
member.summary: The template will be shown when the row is double-clicked.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowEditTemplateUIType.OnEnterEditMode
member.summary: The template will be shown when attempting to enter any cell on a row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowEditTemplateUIType.RowSelectorImage
member.summary: An image will be displayed in the row selectors, when visible, that will open the template when clicked.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowEditTemplateDisplayMode
member.summary: Enum for specifying how the RowEditTemplate should be displayed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowEditTemplateDisplayMode.Modal
member.summary: The template is shown as a modal dialog. Any clicks outside of the bounds of the template are ignored and the template will retain focus.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowEditTemplateDisplayMode.Modeless
member.summary: The template is shown as a top-level window. Clicks outside of the bounds of the template will not cause it to close, though it can lose focus.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowEditTemplateDisplayMode.Popup
member.summary: The template is shown as a popup. Clicking outside of the bounds of the template will cause it to close.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.AllowCardPrinting
member.summary: Enum for specifying property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.AllowCardPrinting.Never
member.summary: UltraGrid will never print cards, it will print all bands in tabular view, regardless of the property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.AllowCardPrinting.RootBandOnly
member.summary: UltraGrid will honor the property on the root-level band when printing.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ReserveSortIndicatorSpaceWhenAutoSizing
member.summary: Represents the different ways to auto-size a column with regard to the space needed for the sort indicator.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ReserveSortIndicatorSpaceWhenAutoSizing.Default
member.summary: Use the default functionality.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ReserveSortIndicatorSpaceWhenAutoSizing.WhenVisible
member.summary: Only reserve space for the sort indicator when it is visible in the column header.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ReserveSortIndicatorSpaceWhenAutoSizing.WhenColumnIsSortable
member.summary: Reserve space for the sort indicator when the column can be sorted.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxVisibility
member.summary: Enum used for specifying when the UltraGridColumn's Header checkbox should should be displayed

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxVisibility.Default
member.summary: Default. The default value for the enumeration. Generally, properties with a value of "Default" should resolve to "Never".

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxVisibility.Never
member.summary: Never. The checkbox is never displayed in the column header.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxVisibility.Always
member.summary: Always. The checkbox will always be displayed in the column header.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxVisibility.WhenUsingCheckEditor
member.summary: WhenUsingCheckEditor. The checkbox will be displayed when the column's Editor resolves to an editor of type CheckEditor.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxAlignment
member.summary: Enum used for specifying the position of the UltraGridColumn's Header checkbox relative to the caption

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxAlignment.Default
member.summary: Default. The default value for the enumeration. Generally, properties with a value of "Default" should resolve to "Left" or "Top" depending on the orientation of the header text. If no text is displayed, the checkbox should be centered.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxAlignment.Left
member.summary: Left. The checkbox is displayed on the left side of the Header caption. Valid when the header text is displayed horizontally.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxAlignment.Center
member.summary: Center. The checkbox is displayed in the center of the header when no caption is used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxAlignment.Right
member.summary: Right. The checkbox is displayed on the right side of the Header caption. Valid when the header text is displayed horizontally.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxAlignment.Top
member.summary: Top. The checkbox is displayed on the top side of the Header caption. Valid when the header text is displayed vertically.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxAlignment.Bottom
member.summary: Bottom. The checkbox is displayed on the bottom side of the Header caption. Valid when the header text is displayed vertically.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxSynchronization
member.summary: Enum used for specifying how the UltraGridCell Values will be synchronized with UltraGridColumn's Header checkbox

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxSynchronization.Default
member.summary: Default. The default value for the enumeration. Generally, the behavior for properties with a value of "Default" will resolve differently based on the value of other properties (such as HeaderCheckBoxVisibility).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxSynchronization.None
member.summary: None. The header checkbox is not synchronized with any cell values.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxSynchronization.Band
member.summary: Band. The header checkbox and the cell values are kept in synch. The entire band is affected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.HeaderCheckBoxSynchronization.RowsCollection
member.summary: RowsCollection. The header checkbox and the cell values are kept in synch. Only the RowsCollection (island) is affected.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfoContext
member.summary: An enum which indicates the type of context for a RowLayoutColumnInfo object.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfoContext.Column
member.summary: The RowLayoutColumnInfo context is an UltraGridColumn

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfoContext.Group
member.summary: The RowLayoutColumnInfo context is an UltraGridGroup

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutStyle
member.summary: Specifies the way in which the band's columns are arranged.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutStyle.None
member.summary: The columns will be arranged in the standard style with no GridBagLayout applied.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutStyle.ColumnLayout
member.summary: The columns will be arranged using a GridBagLayout without Groups. Groups will be ignored.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutStyle.GroupLayout
member.summary: The columns will be arranged using GridBagLayouts on the row and possibly with nested layouts for groups.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FilterOperandDropDownItems
member.summary: An enumeration that indicates which operands should be shown in the filter dropdown menu.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FilterOperandDropDownItems.ShowNone
member.summary: The grid will not populate the list with any items.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FilterOperandDropDownItems.Default
member.summary: The default operands will be shown.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FilterOperandDropDownItems.Blanks
member.summary: Show cells with blank values, such as null, DBNull, and an empty string.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FilterOperandDropDownItems.NonBlanks
member.summary: Show cells that are not empty.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FilterOperandDropDownItems.Errors
member.summary: Show cells that have an error, determined by the interface.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FilterOperandDropDownItems.NonErrors
member.summary: Show cells that do not have an error, determined by the interface.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FilterOperandDropDownItems.Custom
member.summary: Provide the option of displaying a filter dialog for the user to manually create a group of filter conditions.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FilterOperandDropDownItems.CellValues
member.summary: The values of the cells in the associated column will be added to the list.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FilterOperandDropDownItems.All
member.summary: The (All) option will be displayed in the list, when used with a of HeaderIcons.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FilterOperandDropDownItems.ShowAll
member.summary: The grid will populate the list with all options.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.AddRowEditNotificationInterface
member.summary: Enum for specifying the property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.AddRowEditNotificationInterface.Default
member.summary: Use the default functionality.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.AddRowEditNotificationInterface.ICancelAddNewAndIEditableObject
member.summary: The ICancelAddNew implementation will be called, if available, followed by the IEditableObject implementation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.AddRowEditNotificationInterface.ICancelAddNewOrIEditableObject
member.summary: The ICancelAddNew implementation will be called. If this interface is not implemented, or the row is not an AddRow, the IEditableObject implementation will be called.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.AddRowEditNotificationInterface.IEditableObjectAndICancelAddNew
member.summary: The IEditableObject implementation will be called, if available, followed by the ICancelAddNew implementation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.AddRowEditNotificationInterface.IEditableObjectOrICancelAddNew
member.summary: The IEditableObject implementation will be called, if available. Otherwise, if the row is an AddRow, the ICancelAddNew implemenation will be called.

member.param: Indicates whether we are forcing the exit.
Indicates whether the edit operation is cancelled by the user (for example by pressing Escape key).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeExitEditModeEventArgs.ForceExit
member.summary: Indicates whether cell is being forced to exit the edit mode.

remarks.p: When ForceExit is true, value set to Cancel property will be ignored.
This happens when grid is in certain situations where exitting the edit mode is required (like when grid is being disposed). If it's one of those situations, then this property will be true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeExitEditModeEventArgs.CancellingEditOperation
member.summary: Indicates whether the edit operation is being canceled.

remarks.p: CancellingEditOperation is true when the user has canceled the editing the cell, for example by pressing the Escape key.

member.summary: Constructor
member.param: Column associated with the column header flter drop down button was clicked on.
If resolves to SiblingRowsOnly, then the RowsCollection associated with the column header that the filter dropdown button is clicked on will be passed in. Otherwise it will be null.
The contents of the filter drop down as a ValueList.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeRowFilterDropDownEventArgs.Column
member.summary: Column associated with the column header flter drop down button was clicked on.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeRowFilterDropDownEventArgs.ValueList
member.summary: The contents of the filter drop down as a ValueList. You can add or remove items from this ValueList.

remarks.p: The contents of the filter drop down as a ValueList. You can add or remove items from this ValueList. When an item is added to the value list, it's DataValue will be used for comparision. DataValue can be a data value or it can be an instance of FilterCondition or ColumnFilter object. Setting the DataValue to a FilterCondition or ColumnFilter instance allows you to add items that have custom filter conditions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeRowFilterDropDownEventArgs.Rows
member.summary: If resolves to SiblingRowsOnly, then the RowsCollection associated with the column header that the filter dropdown button is clicked on will be passed in. Otherwise it will be null.

member.summary: Used for event parameter to BeforeCustomRowFilterDialog event.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeCustomRowFilterDialogEventArgs.#ctor(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridColumn,Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowsCollection,Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.CustomRowFiltersDialog)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Column for which the custom filter dialog is being shown.
The rows collection that's being filtered
The custom row filter dialog.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeCustomRowFilterDialogEventArgs.Column
member.summary: Column for which the custom filter dialog is being shown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeCustomRowFilterDialogEventArgs.Rows
member.summary: Returns null if the resolves to AllRowsInBand otherwise it returns the rows collection that's being filtered.

remarks.p: There are two row filtering modes: SiblingRowsOnly and AllRowsInBand. When it's AllRowsInBand all the rows in a band are being filtered and thus there is no particular rows collection that's being filtered. As a result this property returns null. However if the row filter mode is SiblingRowsOnly where rows of a particular rows collection are being filtered, then this property will return that rows collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeCustomRowFilterDialogEventArgs.CustomRowFiltersDialog
member.summary: Returns the custom row filter dialog.

member.summary: Constructor

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeRowFilterDropDownPopulateEventArgs.Column
member.summary: Column associated with the column header flter drop down button was clicked on.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeRowFilterDropDownPopulateEventArgs.ValueList
member.summary: The value list that will be used as the filter drop down. You can populate the value list and set Handled to true to prevent the UltraGrid from populating the value list.

remarks.p: You can add items to this ValueList. When an item is added to the value list, it's DataValue will be used for comparision. DataValue can be a data value or it can be an instance of FilterCondition or ColumnFilter object. Setting the DataValue to a FilterCondition or ColumnFilter instance allows you to add items that have custom filter conditions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeRowFilterDropDownPopulateEventArgs.Rows
member.summary: If resolves to SiblingRowsOnly, then the RowsCollection associated with the column header that the filter dropdown button is clicked on will be passed in. Otherwise it will be null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeRowFilterDropDownPopulateEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Indicates whether the value list was populated and that UltraGrid should not attempt to pupulate the value list. Default value is false.

remarks.p: If the value list is populated set Handled to true. Failing to do so will result in UltraGrid clearing the value list and populating it with the cell values.

member.summary: Column associated with the column flter drop down.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.AfterRowFilterDropDownPopulateEventArgs.ValueList

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultiCellOperationErrorInfo
member.summary: Contains information on the error that occurred during a multi-cell operation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultiCellOperationErrorInfo.Action
member.summary: Specifies whether to continue with remaining cells, stop or revert the cells modified so far. Default is ClearCellAndContinue, unless explicitly stated otherwise in the remarks section below. Note that this property is honored only if the error occurs with a particular cell. If the error is with the whole operation, then this property has no effect.

remarks.p: During the process of performing multi-cell operations, a cell can have an error. For example, when pasting values to cells, a cell might not accept the value being pasted to it because it's the wrong data type, or it doesn't satisfy the column constraints. In that case the event will be generated. In such a case you can choose to take one of the actions listed in the enum. You can get the cell that had the error using the property. Also note that you can use the event to perform custom conversions of values being copied or pasted.

If however the Error event is fired in response to an error that is not associated with a specific cell, then this property has no effect. For example, when pasting, if the number of cells available for pasting is smaller than the number of cells being pasted, then the Error event will be fired. However such an error is not associated with a specific cell, but rather it applies to the whole operation. In such a case this property won't be honored since the whole operations can't be performed. Note that in such a scenario, none of the cells will be modified.

Note: If you want to prevent the UltraGrid from displaying an error message, set the Cancel to true on the ErrorEventArgs. Alternatively you can also set the to null or empty string to prevent the UltraGrid from displaying the error dialog. This lets you display a custom error message box.
The default value of this property is ClearCellAndContinue except for read-only cells in which case the default value is Continue since the values of read-only cells can not be cleared.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultiCellOperationErrorInfo.ErrorCell
member.summary: The cell where the operation being performed failed. Note that this property will return null if the failure is not associated with a specific cell.

remarks.p: See remarks section of property for more information.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultiCellOperationErrorInfo.Exception
member.summary: The exception, if any, that lead to this error event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultiCellOperationErrorInfo.Operation
member.summary: Specifies the multi-cell operation that's being performed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultiCellOperationErrorInfo.DataErrorInfo
member.summary: If the error is data source related (for example, error updating the row), then this will return an object that contains further information on the error. Otherwise it will be null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultiCellOperationErrorInfo.CanContinueWithRemainingCells
member.summary: Specifies whether the operation can continue with remaining cells.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultiCellOperationErrorInfo.ErrorAction
member.summary: Used for specifying the property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultiCellOperationErrorInfo.ErrorAction.Continue
member.summary: Continue the operation with remaining cells. This option leaves the value of the cell to its current value.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultiCellOperationErrorInfo.ErrorAction.ClearCellAndContinue
member.summary: Continue the operation with remaining cells. This option clears out the value of the cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultiCellOperationErrorInfo.ErrorAction.Stop
member.summary: Stop the operation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.MultiCellOperationErrorInfo.ErrorAction.Revert
member.summary: Stop the operation and revert the previously pasted cells.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ErrorEventArgs
member.summary: Event parameters used for handling data error events

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ErrorEventArgs.ErrorText
member.summary: Gets or sets the error text. This is the text that will be displayed in the error dialog box. You can modify this property to change what is displayed in the error dialog box. To prevent the error dialog box from displaying, set the Cancel to true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ErrorEventArgs.DataErrorInfo
member.summary: If this error event was fired due to a data error, this will return the DataErrorInfo instance associated with it. Otherwise it will return null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ErrorEventArgs.MaskErrorInfo
member.summary: If this error event was fired due to a mask error, this will return the MaskErrorInfo instance associated with it. Otherwise it will return null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ErrorEventArgs.ErrorType
member.summary: Indicates what type of error occurred that prompted this Error event to be fired.

remarks.p: Depending on what type of error lead to firing of this event, all or all except one of DataErrorInfo, MaskErrorInfo and MultiCellOperationErrorInfo will be null. If the ErrorType is Generic, all of DataErrorInfo, MaskErroInfo and MultiCellOperationErrorInfo will be null. If error type is Data, then DataErrorInfo will contain a valid DataErrorInfo object. If it's a Mask error then MaskErrorInfo will return a valid MaskErroInfo object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ErrorEventArgs.MultiCellOperationErrorInfo
member.summary: This object contains information on the error that occurred during a multi-cell operation.

member.summary: Constructor. Initializes a new instance of class.
member.param: The operation being performed.
New values of cells.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeMultiCellOperationEventArgs.Operation
member.summary: The operation being performed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeMultiCellOperationEventArgs.Cells
member.summary: Cells involved in the clipboard operation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.BeforeMultiCellOperationEventArgs.NewValues
member.summary: New values of cells.

remarks.p: New values of cells. This has different meaning depending on which operation is being performed. When copy operation is being performed, this contains the text representation of the cell values. You can write custom logic to convert the cell values to text by getting the original cell value from the Cell object (from the Cells collection) and perform a custom conversion. When pasting, this contains the text representation of the cell value from the clipboard. You can convert the value to the cells data type using custom logic. After converting, set the new value back in this collection. When cutting, the new values are all DBNull. When performing Undo or Redo, the raw cell values are the values that are going to be set on the cells.
To traverse through the cell values, traverse through the collection and index into the CellValues using the interating cell. See the following example.

member.summary: True if the cell is being forced to exit edit mode. If this is true then StayInEditMode will be ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.CellDataErrorEventArgs.StayInEditMode
member.summary: Indicates whether to stay in edit mode. Default value is true.

remarks.p: If StayInEditMode is true, then the cell won't exit the edit mode unless the ForceExit is true in which case the cell will exit the edit mode regardless.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.CellDataErrorEventArgs.RaiseErrorEvent
member.summary: Indicates whether to raise Error event. Default value is true.

remarks.p: If RaiseErrorEvent is true, then Error event will be fired. If this is false, then Error event will not be fired.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.CellDataErrorEventArgs.RestoreOriginalValue

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ExpansionIndicatorUIElement.Row
member.summary: The UltraGridRow object represents a row of data in the grid. An UltraGridRow corresponds to a single record in an underlying data source. This property is read-only at run-time.

remarks.p: The UltraGridRow object represents a single row of data, and corresponds to a single record in the underlying recordset. Rows occupy a position in the data hierarchy of the UltraWinGrid between Cells and Bands. The UltraGridRow object is always the child of an UltraGridBand object, and its children are UltraGridCell objects.
Much of the data-binding functionality of the grid involves working with the UltraGridRow object. Whenever an UltraGridRow object is loaded by the grid, the InitializeRow event is fired.

UltraGridRow objects can influence the formatting of the cells they contain through the setting of the UltraGridRow's CellAppearance property. Rows can also be formatted independently of the cells they contain. Frequently, cells are drawn from the top of the row to the bottom and are aligned edge to edge so that they occupy the entire area of the row; the row itself is not visible because cells are always "above" the row in the grid's z-order. However it is possible to specify spacing between and around cells that lets the underlying UltraGridRow object show through. Only then will formatting applied directly to the UltraGridRow object be visible to the user.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ExpansionIndicatorUIElement.UIRole
member.summary: Returns the associated with this element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ExpansionIndicatorUIElement.BorderStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines the border style of an object.

remarks.p: Note that not all styles are available on all operating systems. If the version of the OS that your program is running on does not support a particular border style, borders formatted with that style will be drawn using solid lines.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FilterCondition
member.summary: Class used for defining a row filter condition.

remarks.p: A FilterCondition object defines a single condition. Multiple FilterCondition instances can be added to the . A instance contains a FilterConditionsCollection instance. The ColumnFilter has property which specifies how multiple conditions contained in the ColumnFilter's FilterConditionCollection are to be combined. A can contain multiple ColumnFilter instances. Both the and objects expose ColumnFilters property. This property returns a collection of objects. UltraGrid will filter rows using either the RowsCollection's or UltraGridBand's depending on the what the Override's property is set to. See for more information.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.FilterDropDownButtonUIElement.BorderStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines the border style of an object.

The border style of the AddNew box buttons can be set by the ButtonBorderStyle property.
remarks.p: Note that not all styles are available on all operating systems. If the version of the OS that your program is running on does not support a particular border style, borders formatted with that style will be drawn using solid lines.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridFilterRow.Hidden
member.summary: Overridden. Determines whether the row will be displayed. This property is not available at design-time.

remarks.p: The Hidden property determines whether an object is visible. Hiding an object may have have effects that go beyond simply removing it from view. For example, hiding a band also hides all the rows in that band. Also, changing the Hidden property of an object affects all instances of that object. For example, a hidden column or row is hidden in all scrolling regions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroup.Hidden
member.summary: Determines whether the object will be displayed. This property is not available at design-time.

remarks.p: The Hidden property determines whether an object is visible. Hiding an object may have have effects that go beyond simply removing it from view. For example, hiding a band also hides all the rows in that band. Also, changing the Hidden property of an object affects all instances of that object. For example, a hidden column or row is hidden in all scrolling regions.

There may be instances where the Hidden property cannot be changed. For example, you cannot hide the currently active rowscrollregion or colscrollregion. If you attempt to set the Hidden property of the active rowscrollregion to True, an error will occur.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroup.HiddenResolved
member.summary: Unlike the Hidden property, this property takes into account whether the group is a child of another hidden group.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroup.Index
member.summary: The index of this group in the band's group collection

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroup.Header
member.summary: Returns the Header object associated with the object. This property is read-only at run-time. This property is not available at design-time.

remarks.p: A Header object represents a column or group header that specifies information about the column or group, and can also serve as the interface for functionality such as moving, swapping or sorting the column or group. Group headers have the added functionality of serving to aggregate multiple columns under a single heading.

The Header property provides access to the header that is associated with an object. The Header property provides access to the header that is associated with an object. In some instances, the type of header may be ambiguous, such as when accessing the Header property of a UIElement object. You can use the Type property of the Header object returned by the Header property to determine whether the header belongs to a column or a group.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroup.CellAppearance
member.summary: Determines the formatting attributes that will be applied to the cells in a group.

remarks.p: The CellAppearance property is used to specify the appearance of all the cells in a row. When you assign an Appearance object to the CellAppearance property, the properties of that object will be applied to all the cells belonging to the row. You can use the CellAppearance property to examine or change any of the appearance-related properties that are currently assigned to the cells, for example:
UltraWinGrid1.Override.CellAppearance.BackColor = vbYellow

You can override the CellAppearance setting for specific cells by setting the Appearance property of the UltraGridCell object directly. The cell will always use the values of its own Appearance object before it will use the values inherited from the Appearance object specified by the CellAppearance property of the row or band it occupies.

If any of the properties of the Appearance object specified for the CellAppearance property are set to default values, the properties from the Appearance object of the row containing the cell are used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroup.HasCellAppearance
member.summary: Returns true if an CellAppearance object has been created.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroup.Width
member.summary: Returns or sets the width of an object in container units or pixels.

remarks.p: The Width property is used to determine the horizontal dimension of an object. It is generally expressed in the scale mode of the object's container, but can also be specified in pixels.

When proportional resizing is used for the UltraGridColumn and UltraGridGroup objects, the width of the column increases or decreases proportionally as the area occupied by the column changes size, due to the resizing of adjacent columns or of the grid itself.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.LabelPosition
member.summary: Indicates if and how the label (column header) is be shown in relation to the cell.

remarks.p: There are two row-layout modes concerning column label positioning. Column labels can be displayed with the cells inside of each row or in a separate area. This any setting of this property is honored when the column labels are displayed with the cells however only the None and LabelOnly are honored when the labels are in separate area. By default, the column labels are not displayed with the cells.

When column labels are displayed with cells, they are repeated in every row while in the other mode, they are displayed in a separate area. In card-view, that separate area is the card-label area left of the rows and in non-card-view, it is the header area above the rows. In card-view, setting to a value other than MergedLabels displays the column labels with the cells. In non-card view setting the to WithCellData displays the column labels with the cells.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.LabelPositionResolved
member.summary: Retruns the resolved LabelPosition. In merged-headers mode, since the headers are not with the cells, this property will resolve to None.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.LabelSpan
member.summary: Specifies the portion of SpanX or SpanY that is assigned to label (column header). When LablePosition is set to Left or Right LabelSpan specifies the portion of SpanX for the label and when it's Top or Bottom, it specifies the portion of SpanY for the label. If the LabelPosition is set to None or is not displayed with cells, then this property is ignored. If LabelPosition is set to LabelOnly which means cells aren't displayed then this property is ignored as well and the entire SpanX and SpanY is used for the label. Default value is 1.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.MinimumLabelSize
member.summary: Minimum label size. Default value is Size(0,0) which means it will calculate a reasonable default size.

remarks.p: If MinimumLabelSize property is set to a size with width greater then 0, then the bigger of the MinimumLabelSize width and PreferredLabelSize width will be used as the size of the label. The same applies to height as well.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.PreferredLabelSize
member.summary: Preferred label size. Default value is Size(0,0) which means it will calculate a reasonable default size.

remarks.p: Headers with the same OriginX and SpanX (vertically stacked) with different PreferredLabelSize settings will result in all such cells having the max of the widths when displayed. Likewise headers with the same OriginY and SpanY (horizontally aligned) with different PreferredCellSize settings will result in all such cells having the max of the heights when displayed.

If MinimumLabelSize property is set to a size with width greater then 0, then the bigger of the MinimumLabelSize width and PreferredLabelSize width will be used as the size of the label. The same applies to height as well.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.MinimumCellSize
member.summary: Minimum cell size. Default value is Size(0,0) which means it will calculate a reasonable default size.

remarks.p: If MinimumCellSize property is set to a size with width greater then 0, then the bigger of the MinimumCellSize width and PreferredCellSize width will be used as the size of the cell. The same applies to height as well.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.PreferredCellSize
member.summary: Preferred cell size. Default value is Size(0,0) which means it will calculate a reasonable default size.

remarks.p: If the Width of the PreferredCellSize is set to 0, then the value of will be used as the width. If the Height is set to 0, then a reasonable default height will be calculated.

Cells with the same OriginX and SpanX (vertically stacked) with different PreferredCellSize settings will result in all such cells having the max of the widths when displayed. Likewise Cells with the same OriginY and SpanY (horizontally aligned) with different PreferredCellSize settings will result in all such cells having the max of the heights when displayed.

If MinimumCellSize property is set to a size with width greater then 0, then the bigger of the MinimumCellSize width and PreferredCellSize width will be used as the size of the cell. The same applies to height as well.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.ActualCellSize
member.summary: Gets or sets actual cell size. Setting this property emulates resizing of the column via UI.

remarks.p: Setting this property will resize the column to the specified size. However note that row-layout constraints of other columns may prevent the column from actually realizing the specified size. In other words setting the property and then reading it may return a different value. Also note that setting this property on one column can modify the widths of the other columns if auto-fit columns functionality is enabled or row-layout constraints on other columns require it so. This method emulates resizing of the column via user interface (UI).
You can specify width or height component of the value as 0 in which case that component will not be resized.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.ActualLabelSize
member.summary: Gets or sets actual label size. Setting this property emulates resizing of the column header via UI.

remarks.p: Setting this property will resize the column header to the specified size. However note that row-layout constraints of other columns may prevent the column header from actually realizing the specified size. In other words setting the property and then reading it may return a different value. Also note that setting this property on one column can modify the widths of the other columns if auto-fit columns functionality is enabled or row-layout constraints on other columns require it so. This method emulates resizing of the column header via user interface (UI).
You can specify width or height component of the value as 0 in which case that component will not be resized.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.Infragistics#Win#Layout#IGridBagConstraint#Insets
member.summary: Indicates the padding around the layout item.

summary.p: OriginX and OriginY define where the layout item will be placed in the virtual grid of the row layout. OriginX specifies the location horizontally while specifies the location vertically. These locations are the coordinates of the cells in the virtual grid that the row layout represents.
The leftmost cell has OriginX of 0. The constant specifies that the item be placed just to the right of the item that was added to the layout manager just before this item was added.
The default value is . OriginX should be a non-negative value.

OriginX and OriginY define where the layout item will be placed in the virtual grid of the row-layout. OriginX specifies the location horizontally while specifies the location vertically. These locations are the coordinates of the cells in the virtual grid that the row-layout represents.
The topmost cell has OriginY of 0. The constant specifies that the item be placed just below the item that was added to the layout manager just before this item was added.
The default value is . OriginY should be a non-negative value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.Infragistics#Win#Layout#IGridBagConstraint#SpanX
member.summary: Specifies the number of cells this item will span horizontally. The constant specifies that this item be the last one in the row and thus occupy remaining space.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.Infragistics#Win#Layout#IGridBagConstraint#SpanY
member.summary: Specifies the number of cells this item will span vertically. The constant specifies that this item be the last one in the column and thus occupy remaining space.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.Infragistics#Win#Layout#IGridBagConstraint#WeightX
member.summary: Indicates how the extra horizontal space will be distributed among items. Default value is 0.0. Higher values give higher priority. The weight of the column in the virtual grid the row-layout layout represents is the maximum WeightX of all the items in the row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowLayoutColumnInfo.Infragistics#Win#Layout#IGridBagConstraint#WeightY
member.summary: Indicates how the extra vertical space will be distributed among items. Default value is 0.0. Higher values give higher priority. The weight of the column in the virtual grid the grid-bag layout represents is the maximum WeightY of all the items in the column.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupLayoutItemBase.Infragistics#Win#Layout#ILayoutChildItem#GetDropGroup(Infragistics.Win.Layout.GridBagLayoutDragStrategy.DropLocation)
member.summary: Returns the group into which an item will be dropped relative to this element.
member.remarks: This methods takes a DropLocation and determines what group an item dropped at that location should be dropped into. If the item is a content, then the group is the parent group of that content. If the item is a group header, then the item may be dropped inside the group or into it's parent, depending on the DropLocation relative to the position of the header. For example, if the group header is on top, dropping an item on the bottom of the header should place that item inside the group while dropping the item to the left, right, or top of the header should place the item as a sibling of the group.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.GroupByBox.Style
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines the GroupBy box's display style.

remarks.p: This property specifies the display style of the GroupBy box. When set to 0 (GroupByBoxStyle.Full) the full GroupBy Box will be displayed, with the arrangement of the buttons corresponding to the group by columns and bands. When the 1 (AddNewBoxStyleCompact) setting is used, the GroupBy Box will be displayed using as little real estate as possible while still maintaining a visually acceptable appearance.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroupByRow
member.summary: The GroupByRow object corresponds to a GroupBy Row displayed in the grid.

remarks.p: The GroupBy Row appears in a Band of the grid that has been placed in GroupBy mode and has had at least one field specified for grouping data. GroupBy Rows are similar to regular grid Rows except that they do not display data from multiple fields. Instead, they serve to visually separate rows of data according to the grouping to which they belong. A GroupBy Row displays only the data value from the filed or fields being used to group the data.

For example, if you have a Band that contains address data and you use GroupBy mode to group the data according to the value of the City field, You will see the a GroupBy Row appear for every city that appears in the data; the GroupBy Row displays just the name of each city. Following each GroupBy Row will be all the data records contain the same value for the City field as that displayed in the GroupBy Row.

GroupBy Rows can be expanded or collapsed to display or hide the rows corresponding to a particular value. The GroupBy Row also contains the user interface elements needed to expand and collapse rows. Programmatically, you can use this object to find out information about the state of the row grouping, such as whether the grouping can be expanded and how many rows are grouped under the GroupBy Row.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroupByRow.DoesRowMatchGroup(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridRow)
member.summary: Returns true if the row belongs in this group by row by walking up the parent group by rows if any and making sure that the row also matches them.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroupByRow.RefreshSortPosition
member.summary: If the row is not at correct sort position, this method will reposition the row in the rows collection based on the current sort criteria.
member.remarks: This method can be useful in situations where a new row is added to the rows collection (which by default is appended at the end of the collection) and you want to ensure the row is positioned at the right position in the collection based on the sort criteria without having to resort the whole collection. This method should not be used if the sort criteria itself changes which effects the whole rows collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroupByRow.ResolveAppearance(Infragistics.Win.AppearanceData@,Infragistics.Win.AppearancePropFlags)
member.summary: Overridden. Resolves the appearance for this GroupByRow.

remarks.p: Use this method to determine the actual values that are being used to format the GroupByRow. This method initializes the specified AppearanceData structure with the actual values that will be used to display the object. You can combine the bit flags for this method to specify which properties should be resolved.

member.param: The structure to contain the resolved apperance.
Bit flags indictaing which properties to resolve.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroupByRow.GetUIElement(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.RowScrollRegion,Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.ColScrollRegion,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the UIElement object that is associated with an object.
member.param: The ColScrollRegion
The RowScrollRegion
Indicates whether to VerifyChildElements

remarks.p: Invoke this method to return a reference to an object's UIElement. The reference can be used to set properties of, and invoke methods on, the UIElement object associated with an object. You can use this reference to access any of the UIElement's properties or methods.
The Type property can be used to determine what type of UIElement was returned. If no UIElement exists, meaning the object is not displayed, Nothing is returned.

The ParentUIElement property can be used to return a reference to a UIElement's parent UIElement object. The UIElements property can be used to return a reference to a collection of child UIElement objects for a UIElement.
The UIElementFromPoint method can be invoked to return a reference to an UIElement object residing at specific coordinates.
CanResolveUIElement method can be invoked to determine whether an object or one of its ancestors can be resolved as a specific type of UIElement.

The GetUIElement method does not take into account the presence of a pop-up edit window or the drop-down portion of a combo if these elements are present, and will never return a UIElement that corresponds to one of these elements. The GetUIElementPopup method can be invoked to return a reference to a popup window's UIElement.

member.returns: The UIElement associated with the object, in the specified row and column scrolling regions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroupByRow.DescriptionWithSummaries

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroupByRow.IsExpandable
member.summary: Returns true since group by rows can always be expanded

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroupByRow.Column
member.summary: Returns the column associated with this group-by row.

remarks.p: When a Band is in GroupBy mode, the data is grouped according to data fields, which correspond to columns in the grid. To create a grouping, the user can drag a column header into the Band's GroupByBox and the data will be grouped according to the values found in that column.
The Column property of the GroupByRow specifies which column is being used to create the grouping of the current GroupBy Row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroupByRow.Cells
member.summary: Overridden. Returns null since the group by rows don't have any cells collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroupByRow.Rows
member.summary: Returns a collection of the Rows belonging to this GroupByRow.

remarks.p: When a Band is in GroupBy mode, the Rows of the band are grouped together under GroupByRows, based on the values of specified fields (columns) in the Band. When the user drags a column header into the Band's GroupByBox (which specifies the field to use for grouping Rows) the Rows of the grid are grouped together under GroupByRows that represent the values found in the field being used for grouping.
Each GroupByRow will have one or more data rows that share the same grouping criteria. The Rows property of the GroupByRow returns a collection of all the data rows that appear under the GroupByRow.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroupByRow.AutoPreviewHeight
member.summary: Returns the height of the AutoPreview area for the row in pixels.

remarks.p: The AutoPreview area appears under a row and provides a way to display multiple lines of text associated with that row. You can specify how many lines of text should be displayed, and choose to either display the value from a cell in the row or a custom text string that you specify. One common use might be to display the contents of a memo field that initially appears off-screen when the grid is loaded.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroupByRow.Height
member.summary: Allows you to specify the minimum height of the group by row. It only effects the group by row you set this property on.
member.remarks: If a group by row is desired to have bigger height than the default calcualted minimum height, you can set this property to the height desired. A good place to set this property would be in event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGridGroupByRow.Hidden
member.summary: Determines whether the object will be displayed. This property is not available at design-time.

remarks.p: The Hidden property determines whether an object is visible. Hiding an object may have have effects that go beyond simply removing it from view. For example, hiding a band also hides all the rows in that band. Also, changing the Hidden property of an object affects all instances of that object. For example, a hidden column or row is hidden in all scrolling regions.
